text:
SECTION: 2016 Champion (S1) Question 2 Assumption
CONTEXT: User choice for car sharing (Utility).
CONTENT: The **Utility Function** assumes that all components of the utility (time value, money saved) are **linearly additive**. It assumes that the **perceived value of time** (salary) is the primary driver of transport choice.

SECTION: 2016 Champion (S1) Question 1 Model
CONTEXT: Traffic density and speed.
CONTENT: An Exponential Decay function T(p) = K - e^(-rP) was used to model the 'Traffic Factor' as a function of population density (P). This linked higher density to lower average driving speeds.

SECTION: 2016 Champion (S1) Question 2 Model
CONTEXT: User choice for car sharing.
CONTENT: A Utility Function UP = T*S + M was defined, where T is time value, S is salary (opportunity cost), and M is money saved. Users maximized this utility to choose between driving and car-sharing.
